intro: Synotis xantholeuca, commonly known as the yellow-leaved synotis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
